title: RedisEngine does not report missing php-redis module
body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [x] enhancement
* [ ] feature-discussion (RFC)

* CakePHP Version: 4.0.7
* Platform and Target: PHP 7.4.5

### What you did
Configure any cache with `'className' => RedisEngine::class`

### What happened
```
2020-05-08 18:56:34 Warning: Warning (512): Cache engine Cake\Cache\Engine\RedisEngine is not properly configured. in [/var/www/html/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/src/Cache/Cache.php, line 161]
Request URL: /
Client IP: 1.2.3.4
Trace:
Cake\Error\BaseErrorHandler::handleError() - CORE/src/Error/BaseErrorHandler.php, line 188
DebugKit\Plugin::DebugKit\{closure}() - ROOT/vendor/cakephp/debug_kit/src/Plugin.php, line 105
Cake\Cache\Cache::_buildEngine() - CORE/src/Cache/Cache.php, line 161
Cake\Cache\Cache::pool() - CORE/src/Cache/Cache.php, line 230
Cake\Database\Connection::getCacher() - CORE/src/Database/Connection.php, line 837
Cake\Database\Connection::getSchemaCollection() - CORE/src/Database/Connection.php, line 402
DebugKit\Model\Table\RequestsTable::ensureTables() - ROOT/vendor/cakephp/debug_kit/src/Model/Table/LazyTableTrait.php, line 44
DebugKit\Model\Table\RequestsTable::initialize() - ROOT/vendor/cakephp/debug_kit/src/Model/Table/RequestsTable.php, line 53
Cake\ORM\Table::__construct() - CORE/src/ORM/Table.php, line 318
Cake\ORM\Locator\TableLocator::_create() - CORE/src/ORM/Locator/TableLocator.php, line 263
Cake\ORM\Locator\TableLocator::get() - CORE/src/ORM/Locator/TableLocator.php, line 217
DebugKit\ToolbarService::saveData() - ROOT/vendor/cakephp/debug_kit/src/ToolbarService.php, line 232
DebugKit\Middleware\DebugKitMiddleware::process() - ROOT/vendor/cakephp/debug_kit/src/Middleware/DebugKitMiddleware.php, line 66
Cake\Http\Runner::handle() - CORE/src/Http/Runner.php, line 73
Cake\Http\Runner::run() - CORE/src/Http/Runner.php, line 58
Cake\Http\Server::run() - CORE/src/Http/Server.php, line 90
[main] - ROOT/webroot/index.php, line 40
```

### What you expected to happen
Error should be specific, that there is currently missing PHP extension necessary for RedisEngine to work. It might as well be hard error, made the same way as **config/requirements.php**
```
if (!extension_loaded('redis')) {
    trigger_error('You must enable the redis extension to use RedisEngine.', E_USER_ERROR);
}
```
And this also applies to other parts of framework, that require specific php module being enabled
